text: The President of the George Washington University is the chief executive officer of the George Washington University, appointed by the GW Board of Trustees and charged "to establish the University's vision, oversee its teaching and research mission and guide its future."GW Overview | The George Washington University The current president of The George Washington University is Thomas LeBlanc. On January 6 2017, the University announced that Thomas LeBlanc would serve as the 17th President of the George Washington University starting in July 2017. https://gwtoday.gwu.edu/thomas-leblanc- named-17th-president-george-washington-university ==List== President Trachtenberg at his final GWU commencement. {|class="toccolours" cellpadding="1px 6px 1px 6px" style="border-collapse:collapse;" !bgcolor=E6EBEE|Years !bgcolor=E6EBEE|President |- |2017–Present |Thomas LeBlanc |-bgcolor=E6EBEE |- |2007–2017 |Steven Knapp |-bgcolor=E6EBEE |- |1988–2007 |Stephen Joel Trachtenberg |-bgcolor=E6EBEE |- |1965–1988 |Lloyd Hartman Elliott |-bgcolor=E6EBEE |- |1961–1964 |Thomas H.
